titleStmt.title: Psalmos theios, or a Divine psalme or, song, wherein predestination is maintained, yet the honour of Jehovah preserved and vindicated: and to that eternall song the holy scripture dedicated, / by John Davis. Whereunto is annexed an elogie upon the patron, with certaine divine epigrams to whom the author presented some of his books..
titleStmt.author: Davis, John, b. 1628 or 9.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed, andare [sic] to be sold by Humphrey Moseley, at the Princes Arms in Pauls Church-yard, and by Andrew Kemb, at S. Margarets Hill in Southwark,

notesStmt.note: The first two words of title are transliterated from the Greek.

The 'Certain divine epigrams' has its own t.p. which reads: Certain divine epigrams to certain worthy persons, approved friends, and neer relations, to whom the author presented some of his books. London, printed, anno Dom. 1652.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
